Carmen has a 23-year-old son; she’s already a grandmother and one of her pastimes is to go out walking with her grandson who she adores because he’s very affectionate.  Like all good Peruvians, Carmen enjoys our cuisine very much but her favorite dish is fried fish.  She only studied up to third year of secondary school because her parents lacked sufficient resources.

Carmen works at her business selling “salchipapas” (fried potatoes served with hotdogs and sauces), “salchipollo” (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces) and chicken soup.  She spends about 8 hours daily at her work and can serve up to 40 customers.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very charismatic, she gives good customer service and above all because work for her is a joy and she likes to work.

Carmen is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they’ve given her she’ll be able to buy more merchandise for the business like soft-drinks because when she has to buy this type of product in small amounts it’s more expensive.  This improvement will allow her to earn more income and to have more products for her customers so she can continue saving up to make her dream come true: “To have a larger business.”

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de 13,13 y 4 años de edad y estudian, el vive con su familia en la aldea Cuyamapa,  Morazán, Yoro.
Hace dos años que Francisco se dedica a la venta de ropa usada como ropa de cama, chamarras o abrigos y ropa casual y la vende en las comunidades vecinas. Este  negocio lo logro establecer con mucho esfuerzo e  invirtiendo sus propios fondos, ya que el trabajó anteriormente  en  albañilería, soldadura y electricidad. El dedica sábado y domingo a su negocio. 
Actualmente el solicita un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en  la compra de fardos de ropa de cama y de ropa casual, para poder ofrecer producto nuevo a su clientes, y hacer crecer mas su negocio y sus ingresos. 
Su meta es  darles a sus hijos la educación necesaria y en el futuro construirle a cada uno su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 33 years old, married, and has three children (two 13-year-olds and a 4-year-old) who are in school. He lives with his family in the neighborhood of Cuyamapa in Morazán Yoro.

For the past two years, Francisco has been selling bedding and used clothing such as jackets, coats, and casual articles in the neighboring communities. He established this business with great effort and invested his own funds. Francisco previously held jobs doing masonry, welding, and electrical work. He spends Saturdays and Sundays at his business.

Francisco is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of bundles of bedding and casual clothes so that he can offer new products to his customers and grow his business and his income. His goal is to provide his children with the necessary education. In the future, he would like to build a home for each one of them.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bedding and casual clothes.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, tierra caracterizada por sus bellas hamacas y mochilas en tejido vertical, actividad tradicional en esta región del país. Su hogar lo conforma su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años, a quienes planea generar tanto bienestar como el que pueda,  trabajando persistentemente en su negocio de elaboración de bolsos en tejido vertical, con el que actualmente genera ingresos, pero que considera tiene un alto potencial de crecimiento,  que aun no ha explorado  y a él le interesa proyectar su crecimiento para ganar mas dinero. Esta actividad lo aprendió mientras trabajaba en otro taller, donde se dedicaba a tejer bolsos en telar y cuando estuvo preparado se independizó y emprendió su sueño,  de poner en marcha su propio negocio. Con su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda,  haciéndole adecuaciones. Su sueño mas delante de prosperidad,  es ampliar su negocio, mejorar su vivienda y en un futuro tener un buen vehículo.  En la actualidad Rafael está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará hilos en mayor volumen,  para elaborar bolsos, pues necesita responder a pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión y el aumento gradual de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, a land characterized by its beautiful hammocks and backpacks woven on vertical looms, a traditional activity in this region of the country.  His home is composed of his spouse and two children who are 2 and 7 years old who he plans to give as much wellbeing as he possibly can working persistently in his business making bags on vertical looms which is how he currently earns income.  However, he believes that he has high growth potential that he hasn’t yet explored and he’s interested in furthering his growth in order to earn more money.

He learned this activity while working in another workshop where he made bags on a loom and when he was trained he went out on his own and launched his dream of starting a business of his own.  With his business he’s managed to support his family and do some home improvements.  His dream for later on is prosperity, to expand the business, improving his home and in future own a good vehicle.

Rafael is currently applying for his first Kiva loan which is also his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy thread in larger volume to make bags because he needs to fill pending orders he has from customers which guarantees the success of his investment and the gradual increase of his working capital.

loans.use: to buy thread in large amounts.

loans.name: Cruz Del Pilar

texts.es:
Doña Cruz, continua trabajando en su costura, el cual por años ha ejercido su profesion, captando al cliente por su calidad de trabajo, su esposo trabaja en la misma profesion lo que es de gran apoyo.
Sus trabajo son por encargos, y tambien vende en su casa de habitacion, su produccion ah aumentado al hacer mas costura, lo que gracias a los financiamientos ha sido posible cumplir con la demanda. Con este nuevo prestamo comprara variedad de tela, en sincatex, gabardina, clasitex, seda, zipper, botones, entre tela, bordados, adornos, hilos, elastico y otros productos para seguir haciendo sus vestidos. Y obtener mejores ganancias al vender mas.
texts.en: Cruz continues working sewing, her profession for many years, winning over customers thanks to the quality of her work.  Her husband works in the same profession which is a great support.  She works based on prior orders and also sells from home.  Her production has increased since she’s made more items for thanks to the financing she was able to meet demand.  She will use this new loan to buy a variety of fabric like polyester, gabardine, silk, zippers, buttons, fabric, embroidery, decorations, thread, elastic and other products to continue making gowns and earning better profits by selling more.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela  de 57 años de edad es una mujer viuda que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 33 años, ella vive con su familia en San Jacinto, tierra tradicionalmente artesanal, donde se encuentran hermosas artesanías y manualidades, por eso para Graciela no es ajeno esta tradición que data de su familia y ella la practica desde los 11 años de edad cuando aprendió con sus vecinas y familiares este bello arte.  Ella emprendió su idea degenerar ingresos mediante esta actividad y emprendió su negocio vendiendo productos artesanales como bolsos, suvenires, etc.  Pero su principal línea es el bolso. En la actualidad quiere hacer crecer su capital de trabajo pero no alcanza con lo que recoge de su negocio a invertir en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hilos e insumos para hacer una buena oferta de nuevos diseños en bolsos que ya tienen encargado cuando hizo su preventa. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local y continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que logren mucho bienestar y una vida de éxitos.
texts.en:
Graciela, 57, is a widow with four children whose ages range from 26 to 33.  She lives with her family in San Jacinto a land of craftsmen where beautiful crafts and handiwork can be found.  Because of this, this family tradition is not alien to Graciela who has been doing crafts since the age of 11 when she learned this beautiful art from some neighbors and family members.

Her idea to generate income through this activity arose and she started her business selling crafts like bags, souvenirs, etc.  But her main line is purses.  She wants to increase her working capital but what she earns in her business isn’t quite enough to invest in larger volumes and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will use to buy thread and supplies to offer new purse designs that she already has on order through presales.  Her goal for later on is to expand her locale and to continue supporting her children so that they will attain much wellbeing and a life of success.

loans.use: to buy thread and supplies.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Milenio - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
El Señora ESCOLASTICA FLORENCIA 48 años de edad estado civil casada, con 01 hijo menor de edad. Es socio de la  alcancía comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL MILENIO – EL TAMBO”.
Ella actualmente tiene su Restaurante y Cafetín en los interiores de un colegio del estado que vende sus productos como dulces, bebidas, comidas, pasteles, etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, dulces y así pueda venderlas a los alumnos del colegio. Dándose la  oportunidad en el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Desea en el futuro que su hijo termine los estudios en la Universidad. En la fotografía está ubicada la segunda persona  lado izquierda viste con pantalón color marrón, polo y chompa color blanco.
texts.en: Escolástica Florencia, 48, is married and has one minor child.  She’s a member of the “Emprendedoras del Milenio-El Tambo” communal bank.  She currently has a restaurant and snack bar inside a public school where she sells such things as candy, beverages, meals, cakes, etc.  She asked for the loan to buy beverages like soft-drinks and candy to sell to students at the school giving herself the opportunity to improve her income from the business.  She hopes in future that her son completes University.  In the photo she’s the second person from the left wearing brown pants and white shirt and sweater.

loans.use: to buy beverages and sweets.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Ventura Group

texts.es: Teodora de 60 años de edad es viuda y tiene 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de sábanas, toallas, frazadas y otros productos para el hogar. Tiene 4 años en este negocio el cual comenzó con la venta de tazas y platos de plástico con la idea de poder obtener mayores ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y pago de servicios. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en diferentes casas haciendo limpieza a domicilio. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Actualmente sus ingresos los destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y compra de mercadería para su negocio. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un local propio para la venta de sus productos. Usará el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Teodora pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Los Ángeles de Ventura” el cual esta conformado por 6 personas y que le pusieron el nombre debido a que una de las socias del grupo constituyó un colegio en su zona con el mismo nombre.
texts.en:
Teodora, 60, is a widow and has six children.  She sells sheets, towels, blankets and other items for the home.  

She’s been in business four years which she started selling plastic cups and plates with the idea of earning higher income to cover food and utility costs.  She used to work in various houses doing domestic labor.  

With her effort and work she’s managed to build her house and raise her children.  She currently earmarks her earnings to cover food costs and to buy merchandise for her business.   Her plan for the future is to open her own locale to sell her wares.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise.

Teodora belongs to the Los Ángeles de Ventura” communal bank which has six members who named it that because one of the members of the group built a school in the area with the same name.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Marcial

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 53 años y vive con su familia de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Turrialba, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago fue fundada en 1563 por el conquistador español Juan Vázquez de Coronado, fungió como capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823 y fue sede de la primera corte internacional permanente de la historia mundial, la Corte de Cartago. Su relieve montañoso está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca.

Desde hace algunos meses Jorge necesita, que se les brinde algún tipo de ayuda con su medio de transporte ya que se dedica a cosechar, vender y distribuir; las frutas y hortalizas que produce.

Es por esto que Jorge está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para la mano de obra y repuestos del arreglo de su automóvil, ya que lo que quiere es que su transporte no falle mas, puedan aumentar sus ventas y pueda de la misma manera incrementar sus ingresos para su bienestar y el de su familia.

Jorge es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de CREINSA, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jorge, 53, lives with his family in the community of Turrialba in Cartago Province.  The city of Cartago was founded in 1563 by the Spanish conquistador Juan Vázques de Coronado and it was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823 as well as the seat of the world’s first international court, the Corte de Cartago.  It’s mountainous terrain is formed by two ranges: Central and Talamanca.

For the last few months Jorge has needed some sort of help with his means of transportation since he harvests and sells the fruit and vegetables he grows.  Because of this, Jorge is asking for a 500,000.00 (five-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy spare parts and pay labor costs to repair his car because he wants his means of transportation to stop breaking down so that his sales can increase as well as his income for his and his family’s wellbeing.

Jorge is a member of “Creinsa” communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be his 4th loan and he hopes with it to continue growing both personally and economically besides participating actively in his community’s credit organization.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos  de 49 años de edad se dedica a la venta de bolsos artesanales desde la ciudad de Cartagena,  donde tiene sus clientes principales desde hace 2 años, momento desde el cual  viaja a San Juan Nepomuceno y lleva a Cartagena  hermosas mochilas tejidas tradicionalmente  por mujeres de esa población y las vende a una clientela fija, que e compra a crédito y muchas veces de contado. Su negocio surgió, porque visitando a un familiar oriundo de San Jacinto, apreció la belleza de estas manualidades y las oportunidades comerciales en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años. Para conseguir sus primeros contactos con proveedores, fue apoyado por su familiar , mientras Carlos inició su promoción para lograr construir su primera clientela, la cual se ha ido extendiendo y aumentando las exigencias de su capital de trabajo para responderles. Este es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará bolsos para toda ocasión, inversión que planea será exitosa, porque con ella responde a pedidos de sus clientes. Su meta es ampliar su infraestructura de negocio y tener su propio local mas adelante, pero su desafío es  el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 49, is engaged in selling handcrafted bags in the city of Cartagenea where he has had his principal clients for the past two years. He travels to San Juan Nepomuceno and brings the beautiful back packs, traditionally woven by the women there, to Cartagena where he sells them to a fixed customer base. His customers buy from him on credit and many times on an installment plan.

Carlos’ business started due to a visit to a relative who is a native of San Jacinto [9 miles from San Juan Nepomuceno] where he was struck by the beauty of the handicrafts and by the business opportunities in the city of Cartagena where he lives with his family, consisting of his wife and his two children, aged 9 and 13. A relative helped him make his first contact with suppliers while he started promotions in order to build up his first clientele. 

His customers have been growing and increasing his need for more working capital in order to respond to them. This is exactly why he has come to Kiva for a loan, his first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy bags for all occasions, an investment that he projects will be successful because he will use the money to fill his customers’ orders. His goal is to expand his business infrastructure and have his own shop in the future. However, his challenge is the lack of working capital to do so.

loans.use: to buy bags for all occasions.

loans.name: Pracellis Del Carmen

texts.es: Pracellis de 33 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas o catalogo desde hace 6 años aproximadamente, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y 4 sus hijos en las edades de 9 a 18 años, con ellos sueña verlos convertidos en profesionales de éxito. En su negocio tiene un gran número de clientes en el barrio donde habita  y en otros sectores de la ciudad, a quienes les vende a crédito; Pracellis  además es profesora de un jardín infantil y con sus ingresos apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo que le  permite aportar al mejoramiento de su familia y cubrir sus gastos personales, en sus estados financiero muestra un margen de rentabilidad  acorde al tipo de negocio, su cartera rota con agilidad lo que le permite estar reinvirtiendo constantemente y aprovechar las promociones que llegan con grandes descuentos y esto es lo que fideliza sus clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará camisetas y ropa en general, así como productos que han solicitado sus clientes, que muestran un buen descuento, lo cual hace que su inversión tenga éxito, porque está enmarcada en pedidos de sus mejores compradores que bien le pagan.
texts.en: Pracellis, 33 years old, has sold products via catalogues for 6 years. She lives in her own house with her husband, as well as her 4 children, who range in age from 9 to 18 years. She dreams of seeing them become successful professionals. In her business, she has a large number of customers in the neighborhood where she lives and in other areas of the city, to whom she sells on credit. Pracellis is also a teacher at a day care center, and with her income she helps her husband with the household expenses. Her monthly sales provide her with a good profit margin, which allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family and to cover her personal expenses. In her financial statements she shows a profit margin in keeping with the type of business. She rotates her stock quickly, which allows her to constantly reinvest in her business and take advantage of the promotions that come with large discounts, and this is what makes her customers loyal to her. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase t-shirts and clothing in general, as well as the products her customers have asked her for, which are available at a good discount. This ensures her investment will be successful, because it is based on orders from her best customers who pay her well.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts and clothing in general

loans.name: Nueva Generación (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Generación está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca conocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", la ciudad cultural del país, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Esta ciudad tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía cautivando los paladares de propios y extraños. Nuestras socias al igual que toda su gente son personas amables, gentiles y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Janneth,  tiene 37 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 9 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, ella está muy contenta ya que se encuentra embarazada de 5 meses. Su esposo labora como obrero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Janneth se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, maquillajes, perfumes y también vende plásticos (tupperrware), actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años, trabaja en sus tiempos libres de lunes a sábados, hay veces que sus clientes la visitan en su casa. 

Se encuentra 4 años en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, cosméticos y artículos de plástico de Tupperrware  para tener más variedad en sus productos.
 
Su meta es tener un capital propio para su negocio.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una socia que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Generación is comprised of six women and one man who live in different places in the city of Cuena, which is known as the “Athens of Ecuador”.  It is the cultural capital of the country and has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999.  This city has a rich and diverse culinary scene, capturing local and international flavors.  Our members, like all the people here, are friendly and polite, and they maintain the traditions of their villages.

One member of the group is Janneth.  She is 37 and is married.  She has two daughters aged 9 and 6 who attend school in the city.  She is also happy because she is currently 5 months pregnant.  Her husband works in a factory.  They don’t have their own home, so they rent a house.

Janneth sells clothes, makeup, perfume and Tupperware.  She has been doing this for 5 years.  She works from Tuesday through Saturday, and sometimes customers visit her in her home.

She was been with the communal bank for 4 years, and she will invest the proceeds from this loan in clothes, cosmetics and Tupperware items so she can have a greater variety of products.

Her goal is to have enough capital for her business.

The small photo in the corner of the larger one is of a member who for personal reasons could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, perfume and Tupperware items.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Alba, continua con su negocio, la venta de tortillas, por varios años, palmeando los tres tiempos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos que trabajan.
Como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, en donde mejoro la parte de atrás de un cuarto de concreto, que ahora, comenzara a mejorar la parte de enfrente, dando mejor seguridad y estabilidad a su familia con mejor techo. Para esto comprara materiales de construccion, y comenzar la obra. Esto tambien dara mejor imagen  a su negocio, lo que esta contenta.
texts.en:
Alba is continuing with her business selling tortillas, which she has had for a number of years.  She makes her tortillas by hand, three times each day.  She has the support of her husband and her working children.

Her goal has been to complete construction work on her house.  She improved the back part by adding a room made of concrete, and now she will begin to improve the front of the house.  She will provide better security and stability to her family with a new roof.  To do this, she will buy construction materials and start the work.  She is happy because this improvement will also provide a better image for her business.

loans.use:
to buy construction materials to start improving the front of her house
.

loans.name: Iván

texts.es: Ivan está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, porque con el anterior logró aumentar su capital, comprando en mayor cantidad y vendiendo todo lo que compró, pasabocas, caramelos bolsas de agua detalles y planes para celulares. Con su nuevo credikiva comprará lo mismo y está muy feliz, porque ya va a ser reubicado por el estado local,  en una nueva galería para que exhiba sus productos en orden y puede agregar nuevos.  Él envía “Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a F.M.S.D. porque con su apoyo financiero ha progresado bastante, tanto en el negocio como en su vida personal.”
texts.en: Ivan is applying for a new Kiva loan, because with his previous loan he was able to increase his capital, buy in larger quantities, and sell everything he bought, including snacks, candy, water bottles, and cell phone plans and accessories.  With this new Kiva loan, he will purchase more of the same.  He is very pleased, because the local government is going to relocate his business in a new shopping center where he can display his products in an orderly way and add new products.  He sends "Many thanks to Kiva and to FMSD, because with their financial support he has made a lot of progress, both in his personal life and his business."

loans.use: to buy snacks, candy, water bottles, and plans and accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, además de su agricultura en especial por la cosecha de Uva, espárragos, pallares, los cuales han generado muchos puestos de trabajo ya que actualmente se exportan hacia los distintos países del mundo; así como también por ser la cuna del licor bandera de nuestro país que es el “Pisco”.

Carlos se decida al transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi por las calles de la ciudad, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 50 clientes al día; en épocas festivas puede trabajar todo el día sin parar y es que en estas fechas se puede ganar alguito más nos comenta Carlos; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismático y sobre todo honrado y respetuoso con los clientes.

Carlos agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y con ello tendrá mas seguridad en el manejo del vehículo y sobre todo para salvaguardar la seguridad de sus clientes, esta mejora le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its warm climate in any season of the year.  It is also known for its agriculture, especially for the grape, asparagus, and butter bean harvests that have generated a lot of jobs because currently they are exported to different countries in the world, and for being the birthplace of the national liquor of our country, pisco.

Carlos works transporting passengers in a motorcycle taxi through the streets of the city.  He dedicates about ten hours a day to his business and he can serve up to 50 customers daily.  During the holidays he can work all day without stopping and earn a little bit more, Carlos tells us.  He believes that it is going well for him in his business because he is very charismatic and above all honest and respectful with the customers.

Carlos thanks the Kiva lenders very much because, thanks to the support offered, he will be able to do general maintenance on his vehicle.  With this he will have more security in the operation of the vehicle and, above all, will safeguard the security of his customers.  This improvement will allow him to have greater income and he will be able to continue saving to be able to realize his biggest dream: "To have his own house."

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Lisdiana

texts.es:
Maria Lisdiana tiene 25 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Desde hace algunos años que Maria Lisdiana está estudiando enfermería, su deseo es graduarse lo antes posible para poder brindar su conocimiento y servicio en alguna clínica u Hospital de la comunidad.

En estos momentos lo que desea Maria Lisdiana es solicitar un préstamo por ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones) para el pago de la matricula y mensualidad para asi poder finalizar su licenciatura en enfermería, ya que le encanta esta carrera, desea ayudar a su familia con los ingresos que adquiera cuando empiece a trabajar y ayudarle a la comunidad en lo que más pueda.

Maria Lisdiana es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A, es su primer préstamo, razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Lisdiana is 25 years old and lives with her family in a community in Guanacaste Province. The economy in the Guanacaste area is based principally on cattle raising, although both farming and hydroponics are practiced.

Maria Lisdiana has been studying nursing for several years. Her desire is to graduate as soon as possible so that she can offer her knowledge and service in some clinic or hospital in the community.

At this time Maria Lisdiana wants to request a loan of 500,000 colones to pay the monthly tuition fees in order to finish her nursing degree. She loves this career and wants both to help her family with the income she will acquire when she begins working and also her community as much as she can.
 
Maria Lisdian is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil, S.A. (Guaitil Community Credit Company). This is her first loan and she is very grateful for the opportunity to have access to credit so that she will be able to carry out her life’s plans.

loans.use: to pay the monthly tuition fees for her nursing degree.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan comercializa con frutas desde hace muchos años, cuando procedente de Pinillos en el departamento de Bolívar,  trabajó como albañil y algunas veces se dedicó a la pesca, pero cuando se agotaron los recursos,  decidió  con ahorros   radicarse en la ciudad e Barranquilla y crear su propia aventura de negocios, orientado por su hermano,  quien ya habitaba en esta ciudad desde hacia 12 años;  inicialmente trabajó como empleado en una empresa de frutas y de aquí tomó toda su experiencia en su manejo, conservación y especialmente en su selección; por eso  cuando ya estuvo listo,  se dedicó a vender frutas por su propia cuenta y riesgo, para dar curso a su naturaleza independiente. En la actualidad Juan está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará peras, manzanas, pomelos, fresas, ciruelas, y duraznos al por mayor,  para distribuirlos en pequeños comerciantes y también vender en su punto de ventas. Su negocio ha crecido y él necesita este capital de trabajo, por eso acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización muy conocida en la ciudad. Su mayor desafío ocurre en la época de invierno, se le dificulta el acceso a sus clientes, por eso está trabajando en otras estrategias para llegar a ellos y continuar fidelizándolos.
texts.en: Juan has been selling fruit for many years.  When he arrived from Pinillos in Bolívar Department, he worked as a bricklayer and at times earned money fishing.  But when his resources ran out, he decided to use his savings to resettle in the city of Barranquilla and create his business venture.  His brother, who had already been in the city for 12 years, showed him around.  Initially, Juan worked as an employee for a fruit company.  That is where he gained experience in managing, preserving and especially selecting fruit.  And so when he was ready, he decided to sell fruit on his own and take his own risks, to give free rein to his independent nature.  Currently, Juan is applying for his first credikiva, with which he will buy wholesale pears, apples, grapefruits, plums and peaches.  He distributes the fruit to small shops and also sells from his own sales outlet.  Juan's business has grown, and he needs working capital, which is why he turned to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a well-known organization on the city.  Juan's biggest challenge happens in the wintertime, when having access to his customers is difficult.  And so he his working on other strategies to get to them and to continue to gain their loyalty.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale pears, apples, grapefruits, plums and peaches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy himself a new saxophone, as his current one is in poor condition and does not have quality sound.

loans.name: Sidlia

texts.es: Sidlia, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es separada del padre de sus hijos, vive en compañía de ellos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Sidlia, es la venta de cacao, el cual compra a los productores de las parcelas cercanas a un caserío donde logra conseguir precios bajos, para luego llevarlos en otra ciudad donde los vende a precios más elevados. Tiene entre sus compradores a comerciantes que muchas veces le compran todo lo que lleva a esa ciudad, además del público en general. Lleva realizando éste negocio cerca de 03 años contando con la ayuda de su hermano a quien le paga por viaje realizado y cantidad vendida. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios que le permite pagarse sus gastos y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Este negocio lo aprendió  por iniciativa de su tía, quien también se dedica al mismo negocio, logrando ganarse buenos clientes por su buen trato. Ahora con las ganancias que le deja tiene planes de abrir un bodega de abarrotes en su casa lograr estar más tiempo con sus hijos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de un nuevo lote de cacao a un precio más bajo por el volumen de su compra, para si tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Sidlia is 33 years old. She is a persevering working woman who wants to get ahead. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives with them in her own house. Sidlia sells cocoa which she buys from the growers of the plots near a small village where she manages to buy at low prices, in order to later take to another city where the prices are higher.

She has among her buyers merchants that many times buy everything that she takes to that city, and the general public. She has been doing this business almost three years with the help of her brother who she pays by the trip made and the quantity sold.

She likes the business as it generates the necessary financial income that permits her to pay her expenses and to provide her children with a better quality of life. She learned this business through the initiative of her aunt who is also in the same business, managing to win good clients through her good treatment. Now with the earnings that she makes she plans to open a grocery store in her house to have more time with her children. 

This will be her second loan through the institution of MFP, and so she is waiting for a small loan so that she can fulfill her objectives. With the asked for amount of 1000 soles she will invest in the purchase of a new bunch of cocoa at a lower price by volume in order to have a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy the cocoa plants from a parcel

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con Marcos quien es carpintero, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Constantina es la venta de comida, tradicional y típica de la zona selva del Perú. Para ello cuetna con un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado cerca a un paradero de vehículos. Es así que brinda esta comida a los viajeros que pasan por la zona. Lleva realizando éste negocio cerca de 11 meses, pues anteriormente la necesidad economica que atrevezaban era muy difícil, y solo su hija mayor la ayudaba en su ratos libres para la atención al publico. Ahora le gusta lo que hace, pues es toda una experta en la materia y con el tiempo ha logrado ganarse la simpatía de sus consumidores. Su fin es ampliar su negocio y con el tiempo instalar un restaurante. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles desea invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comida al por mayor, así tendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Constantina is 42 years old. She is a working woman who wants to get ahead. She lives with Marcos, who is a carpenter, and through this relationship she has five children. They live together in their own house.

Constantina’s activity is selling food, traditional and typical of the jungle area of Peru. She has a little street stand located near a bus stop, so she provides food to the travelers passing through the area.

She has been in this business for about eleven months. Previously the financial necessities that she went through were very difficult and only her oldest daughter helped her in her free time attending to the customers. Now she likes what she does, she is an expert in the subject matter and over time has managed to win the affection of her customers.

Her aim is to expand her business and over time open a restaurant. This will be her first loan through MFP, and she is waiting for their cooperation so she can finalize her plans. With the 800 soles she wants to invest in her business by buying the necessary ingredients at wholesale price in order to prepare the food and have higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Angel Ignacio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a don Ángel, tiene 41 años de edad, está soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres.

Él para poder salir adelante y ganarse la vida por si mismo hace mas de 15 años y con la ayuda de su papá instalo un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, bocadillos y otras golosinas, este negocio lo puso para aprovechar que su casa está frente a un colegio y por lo general los chicos consumen todos estos productos, su mamá es la que elabora los bocadillos que él vende en su pequeño local, además  gracias a los créditos que recibió de la institución él ha podido mejora su local, por lo cual está muy agradecido con la Fundación Espoir que le ayudado mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sodas, dulces, golosinas, helados, entre otras cosas que también vende. Está en el banco comunal hace tres ciclos, es uno de los fundadores y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo que le da el banco.

 Su sueño es tener un mejor negocio.
texts.en:
The Ángel Gabriel Community Bank meets every other week in Colorado in the district of Montecristi, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are nationally and internationally recognized. It is a place of the famous Panama hats.

Here we find Mr. Ángel. He is 41 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home. In order to get ahead and earn a living for himself, he started a small store in his home 15 years ago with his dad's help. He sells ice cream, cola, sandwiches and sweets, and he started the business to take advantage of his home's location across from a high school, and the students typically consume all those products. His mom makes the sandwiches he sells. Thanks to the loans he has received from the institution, he has been able to make improvements to his shop, and his is very thankful to the Espoir Foundation that has helped him a lot.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, candy, sweets, ice cream, and other things he will sell. He has been in the community bank for three loan cycles. He is one of the founders and he likes the help and support he receives from the bank.

His dream is to have a better business.

loans.use: buy sodas, candy, sweets, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Oldemar De Jesus

texts.es:
Oldemar  tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace algunos meses atrás Oldemar, se hizo de un pequeño grupo de ganado para tener una mayor estabilidad económica, ya que es chofer de una empresa y se dedica a este trabajo casi el tiempo completo de sus días. Pero ahora necesita meterse más de lleno a la ganadería ya que, sus cuatro hijos empezaran a estudiar y Don Oldemar necesita adquirir más ganado para asi obtener más ganancias y asi poder solventar los gastos académicos de sus hijos, para darles la oportunidad de ser grandes profesionales

En este momento Oldemar está solicitando ₡600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de dos novillos “bien buenos y hermosotes” para su ganado, segun nos expresa Don Oldemar.

Oldemar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Oldemar is 50 years old and lives with his wife and children in a community called San Carlos, which belongs to the second province in Costa Rica, Alajuela. It is an area that is in first place in the national production of coffee and sugar cane. The area also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers and vegetables. And this province is also the location of the Juan Santamaría International Airport, the largest in the country.

Several months ago, Oldemar got a small group of cattle to have greater financial stability, since he is a driver for a business and has been occupied with this work for almost his whole life. But now he needs to get more fully involved with livestock as his four children have begun to study.  Oldemar needs to acquire more cattle to get more profits and thus be able to afford tuition fees for his children, to give them the opportunity to become great professionals.

At this point Oldemar is requesting ₡ 600,000.00 (six hundred thousand colones) to purchase two bulls "healthy and good looking" for his cattle, as he tells us.

Oldemar is a member of the Communal Bank Credit Company of San Francisco, one of 150 organizations that EDESA partners with in Costa Rica. Oldemar continues to grow personally and economically in addition to participating actively in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Diana Esthela

texts.es:
La Señorita Diana es socia del banco comunal Family, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita Diana tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes laboran como empleados privados, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.
 
Ella labora en la atención en un salón de Recepciones hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la venta de cosméticos Yambal actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años.
 
Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos.
 
Su meta es obtener su titulo de Licenciada en Comunicación.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the communal bank Family. She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. This city is the capital of the province of Azuay. It is known as the “Athens of Ecuador.” Its historic center is the largest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive, and enjoys all of the modern conveniences. Its local food captures the palates of the local people and visitors. The people keep the culture and traditions of their town.

Diana is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents who work as private employees. She lives in her parent’s house. 

She has been working as an attendant in a Reception Hall for four years. She works from Monday through Friday from 8:00AM in the morning until 6:00PM in the afternoon. In her free time she works selling Yambal cosmetics and she has been doing this for three years.

This will be her fourth loan cycle in the communal bank and she is going to invest in the purchase of cosmetics. Her goal is to obtain her BA degree in Communication.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Blanca Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Family, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Blanca tiene 41 años, es divorciada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años de edad que trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Blanca se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yambal y Avon, actividad que la realiza desde que saco su primer crédito en el banco comunal y ahora se encuentra en su tercer crédito.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para tener una mayor variedad en su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank Family. She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. This city is the capital of the province of Azuay. It is known as the “Athens of Ecuador.” Its historic center is the largest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive, and enjoys all of the modern conveniences. Its local food captures the palates of the local people and visitors. The people keep the culture and traditions of their town.

Blanca is 41 years old, divorced from her husband, and through her marriage she had two children, 24 and 22 years old who work and help her financially. She does not have her own house which is why she rents.

Blanca works selling cosmetics from the brands Yambal and Avon. She has been doing this since she took her first loan at the communal bank and now she is on her third loan.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of cosmetics in order to have a better variety of merchandise.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
La Señorita Ruth es socia del banco comunal Family, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita Ruth tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y su papá labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es propiedad de sus padres. 

Ella estudia en una Universidad de la ciudad, está en el tercer año de Contabilidad Superior y Auditoria, también trabaja medio tiempo en la atención de unas cabinas telefónicas  donde le pagan un sueldo mensual y labora de lunes a viernes.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en instalar un negocio propio de cabinas telefónicas. 

Sus metas son crecer en su negocio que va a iniciar y culminar sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the communal bank Family. She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. This city is the capital of the province of Azuay. It is known as the “Athens of Ecuador.” Its historic center is the largest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive, and enjoys all of the modern conveniences. Its local food captures the palates of the local people and visitors. The people keep the culture and traditions of their town.

Ruth is 24 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Her mother works doing domestic chores and her father works as a private employee. The house where she live belongs to her parents.

She studies at a university in the city. This is her third year of Advanced Accounting and Auditing. She also works part time caring for some telephone booths where she is paid a monthly salary and she works Monday through Friday. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she is going to invest the loan to set up her own business of telephone booths. Her goals are to grow in her business that she is going to start and to finish her university studies.

loans.use: to install telephone booths

loans.name: Ana Alegría

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aun vive con ella junto a sus respectivas familias pues ambos están casados. 

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las  06h00 hasta las 14h00 de la tarde en su local ya que en las tardes también sale a vender por la localidad empanadas, corviches y otros bocadillos que ella mismo prepara con lo cual obtiene ganancias extras que le ayudan mucho para salir adelante, trabaja sola ya que nos es muy grande su negocio, lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 

Sus sueños son tener muy buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Ángel Gabriel Community Bank meets every other week in Colorado in the district of Montecristi, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are nationally and internationally recognized. It is a place of the famous Panama hats.

Here we find Mrs. Ana. She is 53 years old and her husband died several years ago, but they had two children who are now grown but still live with her with their own families, as they are both married.

She has a small restaurant in her home where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm in her restaurant and in the afternoons, goes out to sell empanadas, corviches, and other sandwiches that she prepares and earns some extra money to help her get ahead. She works alone since her business is not very big. She has been doing this work for more than 4 years, and it is going well for her.

She will use this loan to buy rice, beef, fish, and other ingredients for preparing the foods. She has been in the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are quick and help her a lot.

Her dreams are to have very good health and keep moving forward.

loans.use: buy rice, beef, fish, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is a married woman who has one child. Annabelle is 46 years old and resides at Aloran, Misamis Occidenta, Philippines. Annabelle owns and operates a coco land business venture to make a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Annabelle wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 70 years old, married, has has three children.  She is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.  To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a far where, she plants, harvests, and sells rice. Gertrudes has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Gertrudes is requesting a loan for 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2008, Gertrudes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sonia Merinela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 15 años de edad los mismos que aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad y el menor en colegio. El marido tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudar a sus hijos  en los gastos de sus estudios  se dedica a la venta de  productos naturales de la marca Obnilife, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido. Trabaja tres días de la semana de dos a tres horas al día,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son las vitaminas y adelgazantes.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales Obnilife pues tiene varios pedidos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Ángel Gabriel Community Bank meets every other week in Colorado in the district of Montecristi, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are nationally and internationally recognized. It is a place of the famous Panama hats.

Mrs. Sonia lives here. She is 39 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has four children who are 23, 21, 19, and 15 years old. They still live at home and are students. She older three are in university and the youngest is in high school. Her husband has an aluminum and glass workshop.

She is a great housewife who also works selling natural, Obnilife brand products in order to earn her own money and help her children with their schooling expenses. She sells door to door and also takes orders. She works three days a week for two or three hours a day. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for more than two years and it is going very well for her. Her best-sellers are vitamins and weight loss aids.

This loan is to buy natural Obnilife products as she currently has a lot of orders. This is her third loan with the community bank, and she is the group's secretary. She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is for her children to have professional careers.

loans.use: but natural Obnilife products

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
Vilma, es comerciante de ropa, vive con sus tres hijos, atiende el negocio de la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal, donde tiene un local fijo, para atender a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para repellar las paredes, comprando cemento, arena, para  mejorar la condición de la casa, ofreciéndoles otra condición a sus hijos.
La aspiración de Vilma es tener una casa en mejores condiciones para sus hijos, por lo que espera que este préstamo y su negocio sean su apoyo para mejorar.
texts.en:
Vilma, a clothing salesperson, lives with her three children.  She attends to the clothing sales business in the local market, where she has a fixed location to serve customers.
She is asking for a loan to buy materials to plaster the walls.  She will buy cement and sand to improve the condition of the house, offering another condition to her children.
Vilma's aspiration is to have a house in better condition for her children.  That is why she hopes that this loan and her business are her support to improve it.

loans.use: buy cement and sand to plaster her home.

loans.name: Ericka Patricia

texts.es: Ericka de 27 años de edad tiene una refresquería en un barrio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad;  ella desde la edad de 17 años llegó a Barranquilla, proveniente del departamento del Magdalena, cuando terminó sus estudios de bachillerato, buscando oportunidades de bienestar en esta ciudad. Inicialmente trabajó como empleada de una refresquerías durante tres años, de allí adquirió toda su experiencia es esta actividad y cuando estuvo lista inició su propio negocio, vendiendo minutos a celulares, y con su disciplina de ahorro logró adicionar nuevos productos gradualmente, hasta llevar a su negocio a lo que hoy es : un punto de refresquería y dulcería. Su meta mas adelante es consolidarlo y ubicarlo en un local de mayor tamaño, para ofrecer a sus clientes un ambiente confortable. En la actualidad su clientela está creciendo y requiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, para poder responderle con un constante y  buen surtido  de refrescos, helados, frutas etc. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento con el cual comprará helados, dulces, refrigerios, para aprovechar que se encuentra ubicada en un sector muy empresarial y la demanda de estos productos aumenta cada día mas y Ericka, desea responder a nuevos clientes para cáptalos, fidelizarlos y lograr poco a poco cumplir sus sueños empresariales.
texts.en:
Ericka is 27 years old and has a soda shop in a neighborhood in the downtown area of the city. She came to Barranquilla from Magdalena when she was 17 years old after she graduated, looking for opportunities to succeed in the city. She first worked as an employee in a soda shop for three years, and got the work experience. When she was ready, she began her own business selling pre-paid cell phone minutes. With her discipline in savings she was able to gradually start selling more products until making her business what it is today: a soda and candy shop.

Her dream for the future is to consolidate her business and move it to a bigger shop to offer her customers a more comfortable environment. Her clientele is growing and she needs to increase her capital in order to respond with a constant variety of sodas, ice cream, fruit, etc. For this reason she has come to Credikiva for her first loan to buy ice cream, candy, and snacks to take advantage of her location in a business zone and because demand for these products is increasing every day. Ericka wants to respond to the customers' wishes in order to earn their faithful business and, little by little, achieve her business dreams.

loans.use: buy ice cream, sweets, and snacks

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Sonia, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos menores. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.
 
Ella  para poder salir adelante y ganarse la vida por sí mismo y con esto también ayudar a sus padres, hace mas de 8 años empezó un pequeño negocio de venta de colas, aguas, golosinas, hielo, entre otras cosas.  Con la ayuda de su mamá trabaja todos los días en la preparación de ciertos productos y la venta de los mismos, en su negocio le va muy bien y ahora mejor con la ayuda de los créditos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sodas, dulces, golosinas, helados entre otras cosas que también vende. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Ángel Gabriel Community Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton. The area is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw "Panama" hats. 

It is here that we meet Sonia, age 26. She is single and lives in her parent's house with her younger siblings. She has been with the community bank for three cycles, and she likes the help they've given her. 

In order for Sonia to get ahead in live and support herself - as well as to help her parents - she started a small business more than eight years ago. She sells soft drinks, water, sweets, and ice, among other things. With her mother's help she works every day to prepare certain products and then sell them. Her business is going very well and now even better with the help of the loans. 

Sonia will use this loan to buy soft drinks, candy, sweets, and ice cream, among other things that she also sells. 

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, sweets, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Kanouya

texts.fr:
Kanouya est né vers 1961 à SOMASSO  à  KOUTIALA. Mère de 3 enfants elle vit chez son époux à Niena (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Elle mène cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers marchandises, notamment les tissus, bazins teintés, chemises, parfums et des chaussures et des parures. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il y'a 4 ans maintenant, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 10 pièces de bazin, 60 bouteilles de parfums de divers qualités, 50 paires de boucles d'oreilles et 15 glacières.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Lomé, Bobo Dioulasso ainsi qu’à Bamako. Les ventes se font sur commande, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kanouya was born in about 1961 in Somasso, in Koutiala. The mother of three children, she lives in her husband's home in Niena (in the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

She has been running this business purchasing and selling assorted goods for more than seven years. Her experience in this area has earned her a good reputation and she receives orders for various merchandise, notably cloth [goods]: colored damask, shirts, fragrances, shoes and jewelry. Thus, in order to have the necessary means to satisfy her clients, she [began to] collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago now; her previous loans have been properly repaid.

This new loan will allow her to purchase 10 lengths of damask, 60 bottles of fragrance of varied quality, 50 pairs of earrings and 15 ice chests.

She gets her supplies in the markets of Lomé and Bobo Dioulasso, as well as in Bamako. Her sales are made-to-order [and sold] at retail and for cash to a group of customers made up of men and women.

With this loan, Kanouya expects to see an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs per month. This profit will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted goods.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio de 28 años de edad se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas,  desde hace 4 años cuando aprendió a prepararlos y decidió ofrecer perros calientes, salchipapas (combinación de salchichas con papas fritas) hamburguesas de diferentes carnes que mezcla con salsas y miel pura, a toda la comunidad de vecinos y conocidos . En la actualidad su negocio cada día crece y requiere de mayor capital de trabajo, para hacer compras de contado y en mayor volumen, especialmente de las diferentes salsas que usa, en la preparación de sus productos. Él va  a aprovechar la época de carnaval, periodo en el cual tradicionalmente las ventas crecen, para invertir en grande; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará materias primas e insumos como salsa y miel para cumplir con el objetivo de vender mucho mas y ganar mucho mas también, pues su meta es lograr el reconocimiento de su negocio y aumentar el prestigios de sus deliciosos perros calientes.
texts.en:
Sergio, 28, has worked making and selling fast food for four years, when he learned to prepare hot dogs, "salchipapas" (a combination of sausage and fried potatoes), and hamburgers of different meats that he mixes with sauce and pure honey, and decided to offer them to the whole community of neighbors and acquaintances.

Currently his business grows every day and he needs more working capital to make cash purchases in bulk, especially of the various sauces he uses to prepare his products.  He is going to make the most of the Carnival season (a period in which traditionally sales grow) to invest big.

For this reason he is turning to his Kiva loan, the first financing he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy ingredients and supplies such as sauce and honey to carry out his objective to sell much more and earn a lot more as well.

His goal is for his business to be recognized and to increase the prestige of his delicious hot dogs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as sauce and honey.

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Karen, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años el mismo que este año empieza a estudiar en un jardín de infantes de la localidad. El marido es chofer de un taxi.

Ella es una joven madre y  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y también para sentirse independiente se dedica a la venta de  sabanas, edredones y almohadas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, también vende en su casa donde además también realiza recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y recargas telefónicas. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener un taxi propio para que su esposo trabaje.
texts.en:
The communal bank Ángel Gabriel (Angel Gabriel) meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecrist Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture.  The handicrafts from the region are recognized at the national and international levels.  This is the place of the famious panama hats.

This is where señora Karen lives.  She is 21 years old and with her partner has a 4-year old son, who this year will start at a kindergarten in the area.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Señora Karen is a young mother and homemaker who, in order to have her own resources and to help her husband with the household expenses, and also to feel independent, earns money selling sheets, comforters and pillows.  She sells her merchandise door to door and by taking orders.  She also makes sales from her home where she re-charges cell phones.  She works every day.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments each week.  She has been making her living with this business for more than two years, and it has been going well for her. 

This loan is for the purchase of sheets, comforters and telephone chargers.  This is señora Karen's third cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. 

Her dreams are to keep moving forward and to have their own taxi for her husband's work.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, comforters and cell phone chargers.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa, tienen casa propia, él es agricultor, desde joven aprendió a preparar la tierra y cultivarla, hoy en día esta actividad es la que le ayuda a generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla, para iniciar el proceso, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para iniciar el cultivo con la esperanza que se desarrolle y de abundantes frutos. 
La aspiración de Miguel es conseguir cosechas sanas, abundantes, para poder tener la seguridad alimenticia en su familia, además poder vender para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and they have their own home. He is a farmer; since he was young he has learned to prepare and cultivate the land. Currently farming is what helps him to generate income to maintain his home. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seed to start the process. This loan will give him the necessary resources to begin cultivation with the expectation of growth and abundant fruit. 

Miguel's goal is to achieve healthy, abundant harvests. This way he will not only have food security for his family, but something to sell to generate income as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. Cherry is married and has a business selling personal products in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to customers.

Cherry has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Ligaya is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy food and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ligaya would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits, vegetables, and purified drinking water to sell to customers

Elizabeth has been in this business for 13 years. Elizabeth earns more income from raising pigs, farming corn, and the purified drinking water retail business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to buy a delivery truck to export her bananas in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, and purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old, married and has a 3 children who are in school.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables, selling Avon, Diara and other natural medicines.

Evangeline aspires to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 46 years old and married with three children.

Clemencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Clemencia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns income from rice retail and food sales.

Clemencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Ángel Gabriel se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 5 y 2 años, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de tagua.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella también vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), estos productos los vende en su tienda y de vez en cuando también sale a recorrer, deja estos productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días.  Lleva con su tienda por más de 8 años ya que la heredo de su padre el mismo que al fallecer se la dejo y ella por el amor que le tenía a su papá ha tratado de mejorarla con el paso de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Ángel Gabriel Community Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton. The area is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw "Panama" hats. 

Here we meet Verónica, age 27. She is married and together they have four children, ages 10, 8, 5 and 2; the oldest three attend school. Her husband works in a tagua factory. 

Verónica has a small grocery store in her house where she sells all kinds of basic necessities. She works every day from 6AM until 8PM, and sometimes even later. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women); these she sells in her store and once in a while she also goes out to make the rounds. She leaves these products on credit and collects every eight days. 

Verónica has been with her store for more than eight years - she inherited it from her father - and since his passing, she has tried to improve it every day out of love for him. 

She will use this loan to stock her store; she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, laundry detergent, sausage and other basic necessity items. She's been with the community bank for three cycles, and she likes it because she's made many friends in the group. 

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and for it to grow every day forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, laundry detergent, sausages and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.
 
Mary Ann runs a flower retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of flowers to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of flowers to sell

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru: Хусен проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его сын занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Сам Хусен занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для закупа корма и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Husen lives near Shahrituz. He is 69 years old, married with two children. His son is a farmer growing various crops. Husen has raised cattle for 13 years. He is applying for a loan for food for his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase food for his livestock

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 43 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She  works hard to provide for her family.
